```The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion

Fast fashion has become a dominant force in the fashion industry, driven by the desire for quick turnover of trendy clothing at affordable prices.

text: One of the most concerning environmental impacts of fast fashion is the excessive consumption of non-renewable resources.

text: Additionally, the production of cotton, another commonly used material in fast fashion, has been linked to deforestation, water scarcity, and the extensive use of pesticides and fertilizers.

text: The rapid turnover of fast fashion trends encourages consumers to discard clothing after only a few wears, exacerbating the problem of textile waste.

text: To address the environmental impact of fast fashion, several strategies can be implemented.
